DOC.brief_summary: This study examine effectiveness utilizing video laryngoscopy give real-time guidance neonatal intubation improve resident ' success performing intubation .
DOC.detailed_description: To evaluate whether resident receive guidance supervisor concurrently view neonate 's airway via video laryngoscopy high rate successful neonatal intubation resident receive guidance use traditional direct laryngoscopy . The investigator conduct randomize control trial involve 48 first second year pediatric medicine-pediatric resident receive either video-facilitated ( VDL ) traditional ( TDL ) supervisor guidance direct laryngoscopy . Residents attempt intubation neonatal intensive care unit accord randomization group . The primary outcome successful intubation occur within two attempt .
DOC.criteria: 1st 2nd Year Pediatric MedicinePediatric Residents University Rochester Residents decline participation
